dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/768676472 at Thu Oct  1 20:47:38 UTC 2020

panels.description:
_Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better._
  
### Component Thresholds  
_Satisfactory/Tolerable_  
 * shared_runner_queues: 60s
panels.title: Latency: Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="ci-runners"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="ci-runners"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="ci-runners"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="ci-runners"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

targets.expr:
clamp_max(
  max by (type) (max_over_time(gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}[$__interval]))
  or
  sum by (type) (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}),
  1
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

targets.expr:
avg by (type)
(avg_over_time(gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}[$__interval]) or avg_over_time(gitlab_service_ops:rate{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}[$__interval]))
or
sum by (type) (gitlab_service_ops:rate_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"} or gitlab_service_ops:rate{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"})

targets.expr:
sort(
  max(
    ALERTS{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage=~"|$stage",type="ci-runners", severity="s1", alertstate="firing"} * 4
    or
    ALERTS{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage=~"|$stage",type="ci-runners", severity="s2", alertstate="firing"} * 3
    or
    ALERTS{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage=~"|$stage",type="ci-runners", severity="s3", alertstate="firing"} * 2
    or
    ALERTS{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage=~"|$stage",type="ci-runners", alertstate="firing"}
  ) by (environment, alertname, severity)
)

panels.title: Tooling Links

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

targets.expr:
avg_over_time(gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_5m{component="shared_runner_queues",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}[$__interval])
or on(component, type)
(
  sum by (component, type) (
    (avg_over_time(gitlab_component_apdex:ratio{component="shared_runner_queues",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}[$__interval]) >= 0)
    *
    (avg_over_time(gitlab_component_apdex:weight:score{component="shared_runner_queues",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}[10m]) >= 0)
  )
  /
  sum by (component, type) (
    (avg_over_time(gitlab_component_apdex:weight:score{component="shared_runner_queues",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor!~"global|",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}[10m]) >= 0)
  )
)

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better
panels.title: trace_archiving_ci_jobs Component Error Rates

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="trace_archiving_ci_jobs",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_5m{component="trace_archiving_ci_jobs",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="ci-runners"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="trace_archiving_ci_jobs",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="ci-runners"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_30m{component="trace_archiving_ci_jobs",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="ci-runners"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_6h{component="trace_archiving_ci_jobs",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="ci-runners"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.title: loadavg15 per core

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a service fleet.
If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs
horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners", component="cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cpu component saturation: Average Service CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Disk inode utilization per device per node.

If this is too high, its possible that a directory is filling up with
files. Consider logging in an checking temp directories for large numbers
of files
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - (
        node_filesystem_files_free{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}
        /
        node_filesystem_files{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners", component="disk_inodes"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

      (
        1 - instance:node_filesystem_avail:ratio{fstype=~"ext.|xfs", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}

clamp_min(

panels.title: memory component saturation: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Netfilter connection tracking table utilization per node.

When saturated, new connection attempts (incoming SYN packets) are dropped with no reply, leaving clients to slowly retry (and typically fail again) over the next several seconds.  When packets are being dropped due to this condition, kernel will log the event as: "nf_conntrack: table full, dropping packet".
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      max_over_time(node_nf_conntrack_entries{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}[1m])
      /
      node_nf_conntrack_entries_limit{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: nf_conntrack_entries component saturation: conntrack Entries per Node

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners", component="open_fds"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance

panels.description:
Private runners utilization per instance.

Each runner manager has a maximum number of runners that it can coordinate at any single moment.

When this metric is saturated, new CI jobs will queue. When this occurs we should consider adding more runner managers,
or scaling the runner managers vertically and increasing their maximum runner capacity.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, instance) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum without(executor_stage, exported_stage, state) (
        max_over_time(gitlab_runner_jobs{job="runners-manager",shard="private"}[1m])
      )
      /
      gitlab_runner_limit{job="runners-manager",shard="private"} > 0
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners", component="private_runners"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: private_runners component saturation: Private Runners utilization

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a shard of a
service fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the
shard needs horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners", component="shard_cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: shard_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Shard

panels.description:
Shared runner utilization per instance.

Each runner manager has a maximum number of runners that it can coordinate at any single moment.

When this metric is saturated, new CI jobs will queue. When this occurs we should consider adding more runner managers,
or scaling the runner managers vertically and increasing their maximum runner capacity.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, instance) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum without(executor_stage, exported_stage, state) (
        max_over_time(gitlab_runner_jobs{job="runners-manager",shard="shared"}[1m])
      )
      /
      gitlab_runner_limit{job="runners-manager",shard="shared"} > 0
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners", component="shared_runners"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: shared_runners component saturation: Shared Runner utilization

panels.description:
Shared runners utilization per instance.

Each runner manager has a maximum number of runners that it can coordinate at any single moment.

When this metric is saturated, new CI jobs will queue. When this occurs we should consider adding more runner managers,
or scaling the runner managers vertically and increasing their maximum runner capacity.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, instance) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum without(executor_stage, exported_stage, state) (
        max_over_time(gitlab_runner_jobs{job="runners-manager",shard="shared-gitlab-org"}[1m])
      )
      /
      gitlab_runner_limit{job="runners-manager",shard="shared-gitlab-org"} > 0
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: shared_runners_gitlab component saturation: Shared Runner GitLab Utilization

panels.description:
Average CPU utilization per Node.

If average CPU is satured, it may indicate that a fleet is in need to horizontal or vertical scaling. It may also indicate
imbalances in load in a fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without(cpu, mode) (1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners"}[5m]))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="ci-runners", component="single_node_cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)
